conflicts.description: singularityce: singularity requires a Linux VM on Windows & Mac
conflicts.name: arch=darwin-None-None

dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
An OCI container runtime monitor that tracks and logs container
lifecycle events.
dependencies.name: conmon

dependencies.description: Cryptsetup and LUKS - open-source disk encryption.
dependencies.name: cryptsetup

dependencies.description:
Git is a free and open source distributed version control system
designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with
speed and efficiency.
dependencies.name: git

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description: The golang compiler and build environment
dependencies.name: go

dependencies.description:
The reference implementation of the Linux FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace)
interface
dependencies.name: libfuse

dependencies.description: Common error values for all GnuPG components.
dependencies.name: libgpg-error

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.
dependencies.name: pkgconfig

dependencies.description:
Tools to help unprivileged users create uid and gid mappings in user
namespaces.
dependencies.name: shadow

dependencies.description: Util-linux is a suite of essential utilities for any Linux system.
dependencies.name: uuid

dependent_to.description: The Python API for working with Singularity containers.
dependent_to.name: py-spython

dependent_to.description:
Local filesystem registry for containers (intended for HPC) using Lmod
or Environment Modules. Works for users and admins.
dependent_to.name: singularity-hpc

description:
Singularity is a container technology focused on building portable
encapsulated environments to support "Mobility of Compute" For older
versions of Singularity (pre 3.0) you should use singularity-legacy,
which has a different install base (Autotools). Needs post-install
chmod/chown steps to enable full functionality. See package definition
or `spack-build-out.txt` build log for details, e.g. tail -15 $(spack
location -i singularityce)/.spack/spack-build-out.txt
name: singularityce

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
